content.description: Vary burly V4. Starting on obvious rail and pulling to obvious holds out Left to finish directly above start.
content.location: Part of the "thinking man rock", on the direct opposite side of Plato and Ptolemy. Bushwhack and scramble around the boulder left of Plato.

content.description: Stand start on right hand crimp and left thumb on sidepull. Climb up trending left then topout using great jugs over the lip.
content.location: Rightmost problem opposite of Confucius. From the cul de sac, follow the trail, then take a right at the Y split. Cross Pine Creek using two ladders. First boulder on your right.

content.description: Start with left hand sidepull, right hand undercling. Work your way up using a series of good rails, jugs, and crimps. Plenty of holds to play around with to make this climb your own.
content.location: Middle of legacy boulder. From the cul-de-sac, walk the trail until the Y split. Take a right and cross Pine Creek using the two wooden ladders. Boulder is just to the left once past the second ladder.

content.description: Start with left hand crimp, right hand lower sidepull. Pull to higher left pinch before gaining higher feet and finding right hand crimp. Top out using variety of crimps, jugs and sidepulls. Good feet throughout.
content.location: Middle of Legacy Boulder, directly left of Legacy Direct. Take a right and cross Pine Creek using the two wooden ladders. Boulder is just to the left after the second ladder.

content.description: Cleaned by David McCole. Wonderful route with 2 or 3 ways up the slippery rose quarts. All beta is fun and good. Route trends up and right to finish on some jugs.
content.location: Part of the "Thinking Man Boulder" which is directly up and right of the initial boulder next to the stream. Small scramble and just a little bit of bushwhacking to two beautiful routs.

content.description: SDS with hands matched on low rail. Work your way up using the arete for an easy top out.
content.location: Leftmost route on the Scout Boulder.  From the cul-de-sac, walk the trail until the Y split. Take a right and cross Pine Creek using the two wooden ladders. Take a left past the Legacy boulder and continue up the hill and past the Baby Bluff Boulder. Continue left into the talus field. Boulder is located near the top and in the middle.

content.description: Sit start with left hand crimp along prominent rail and left hand crimp below overhanging feature. Bump up and match on rail, then crossover to a small crimp. Throw for huge jug on the right side of the boulder. Gain a better foot using prominent rail and  then top out up and over the overhanging feature.
content.location: Rightmost problem on the legacy boulder. From the cul-de-sac, walk the trail until the Y split. Take a right and cross Pine Creek using the two wooden ladders. Boulder is just to the left once past the second ladder.

content.description: Burley but otherwise easy route. Starts on the same start as Hover, stay low traversing left and topping out on the far left side of the boulder.
content.location: Boulder directly off of trail after crossing the second bridge.

content.description: SDS with left hand low crimp, right hand on juggy arete, and heel hook on lower arete. Bump up the arete then utilize a pinch and small crimp above the arete. Gain higher feet and mantle. Crux is the mantle as holds get better up top.
content.location: Left side of Legacy boulder.  From the cul-de-sac, walk the trail until the Y split. Take a right and cross Pine Creek using the two wooden ladders. Boulder is just to the left once past the second ladder.

content.description: Short, but somewhat fun problem. Start on diagonal mouth feature. Move up to slopey rail and pinch before finding jugs to top out on.
content.location: On the left side of the Scout boulder. Atop the talus field, across the creek. From the parking area, walk the trail until the Y split. Take a right and cross Pine Creek using the two wooden ladders. Take a left past the Legacy boulder and continue up the hill and past the Baby Bluff Boulder. Continue left into the talus field. This boulder is located near the top in the middle.

content.description: Stand start matched on right side of the boulder. Traverse left using great holds and top out into boy scout.
content.location: Right most rout on the scout boulder. From the parking area, walk the trail until the Y split. Take a right and cross Pine Creek using the two wooden ladders. Take a left past the Legacy boulder and continue up the hill and past the Baby Bluff Boulder. Continue left into the talus field. This boulder is located near the top in the middle.

content.description: Unnecessary, but fun and balancey traverse. Start with left hand on low rail, right hand on sidepull. Pull to standing and use variety of underclings and sidepulls to make your way left working your feet on the prominent rail. Finish this problem by going up Girl Scout.
content.location: Starts on the right side of the Scout Boulder.  From the cul-de-sac, walk the trail until the Y split. Take a right and cross Pine Creek using the two wooden ladders. Take a left past the Legacy boulder and continue up the hill and past the Baby Bluff Boulder. Continue left into the talus field. Boulder is located near the top and in the middle.

content.description: SDS with left hand low crimp and prominent right hand side pull. Climb up using a jug and diagonal rail, then top out. Crux is at the start.
content.location: Middle route on the scout boulder, which is atop the talus field. From the cul-de-sac, walk the trail until the Y split. Take a right and cross Pine Creek using the two wooden ladders. Take a left past the Legacy boulder and continue up the hill and past the Baby Bluff Boulder. Continue left into the talus field. Boulder is located near the top and in the middle.

content.description: A small talus field exists on opposing side of the creek in relation to the parking area. Some development has occurred, but should be continued to be explored. Nearby boulders on this side of the river are included within this area.
